Description: Five glass eye-beads strung together; probably rod-formed in slightly translucent blue glass with eye-motifs trailed on in yellow glass; the trails on one of the beads are raised, the others appeared to have been marvered flush with the surface of the core; surfaces cracked and worn.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.122, Tomb 168)
